data: CARD SURG Transcatheter Alternative Access Heart Valve Implantation CSICU Admission
Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Complete Admission or Transfer Medication Reconciliation
Discontinue CARD SURG Day of Surgery PowerPlan
1 - No CPR, Supportive Care, No Intubation
2- No CPR, Therapeutic Care, No Intubation
3 - No CPR, Acute Transfer, No Intubation
4 - No CPR, Critical Care, No Intubation
5 - No CPR, Critical Care, May Intubate
Refer to Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation: Alternative Access Pathway
SBP goal: see order comment for SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, Hgb Goal: 75 g/L or greater
RASS goal start at -5, wean sedation to meet goal of RASS 0
Notify provider if chest tube loss is greater than 200 mL for 2 hours
Notify provider if urine output is less than 0.5 mL/kg/h for 3 hours
If less than 8 Fr on POD 0 as per Cardiac Cath Lab protocol
If less than 8 Fr on POD 0 as per Cardiac Cath Lab protocol
Subclavian/axillary approach: remove within 2 to 4 hours post CSICU admission
When stable and sheaths removed, mobilize within 12 hours. Up in chair for meals and PRN
Turn patient q2h, maintain HOB 30 degrees or greater
T+1;0830, Start: Clear Fluid Diet, Advance to: Regular Diet, no salt packages. RN or RD to place subsequent diet order
T+1;0830, Start: Clear Fluid Diet, Advance to: Other (Please Specify), Advance to Diabetic Diet. RN or RD to place subsequent diet order
KCL 40 mmol/L-dextrose 5%-sodium chloride 0.9% (KCL 40 mmol/L-D5W-NaCL 0.9% continuous infusion)
order rate: 30 mL/h, IV, drug form:bag
500 mL, IV, once, PRN other (see comment) order duration: 24 hour, drug form bag

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
